entityId.localType: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office Series Number

nameEntry.part: Hobart Area Office - Case Records of the Childrens Court in Southern Tasmania

biogHist.abstract: Hobart Area Office - Case Records of the Childrens Court in Southern Tasmania were created between 1962 and 1980. They contain personal information about children who came before the Children's Court between these dates.
biogHist.p:
Closed D75 years
D75 means these records are closed to the general public for 75 years from the date of the last entry in them. People wishing to access these records should contact Children and Youth Services, which is run by the Department of Health and Human Services. How access is provided once permission is granted will depend on the file. Usually Children and Youth Services request it back and then provide access or copies. Staff at the Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office may be able to assist you in finding other relevant records.
At some stage, an employee of the Department removed these case records from the Correspondence Files which have the series number AD203.
There are 37 items in this series. They are arranged chronologically. Their listing can be viewed by going to the Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office website.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office Records (1965 - )
Record of Cases Heard in Children's Court, Hobart Magistrates' Court (1906 - 1981)

descriptiveNote.p: The archival series, Hobart Area Office-Case Records of the Children's Court in Southern Tasmania, is related to the Record of Cases Heard in Childrens Court.

Social Welfare Department, State of Tasmania (1961 - 1983)

descriptiveNote.p: These case records have been removed from the Correspondence Files.
